content: songbird materials required dk or light worsted weight yarn in the following amounts color a back tail top of head wings 20 yards color b breast bottom of head 10 yards size 2 double pointed needles size 2 straight needles optional darning needle stuffing abbreviations co cast on dpn double pointed needle k knit p purl st stitch sts stitches m1 make one stitch see special note below m1r make one stitch that leans to the right see special note below m1l make one stitch that leans to the left see special note below k2tog knit two stitches together p2tog purl two stitches together ssk slip two sts k-wise place them back onto left dpn then k them decrease through back loop pu pick up create a new stitch from existing work wt wrap and turn see special note below x the number of times to work instruction in parentheses 1 special notes please read first the body of your songbird is worked flat with the intarsia method of colorwork in order to make his breast a different color it can be knitted on dpns or straight needles at most there will be 27 sts on one needle at a time suggested color changes are included in the pattern but they can be eliminated completely to make a one-color bird or altered for a different color head tail wings etc as desired anytime the stitch count changes increases or decreases in a row the new stitch count will be seen in parenthesis at the end of the row m1 = make one stitch lift the right leg of the next stitch the right side of the stitch directly below the next stitch on your left needle place it on the left needle then knit it as you would any other stitch m1r = make one stitch that leans to the right lift the strand between the stitches from back to front then knit the lifted loop through the front m1l = make one stitch that leans to the left lift the strand between the stitches from front to back then knit the lifted loop through the back wt = wrap and turn after knitting the specified number of stitches bring yarn to the front of work slip the next st on the left dpn to the right one move yarn to the back of your work and slip the stitch back to the left needle this wraps the stitch turn your work and purl the number of stitches indicated bring yarn to the back of work slip the next st on the left dpn to the right one move yarn to the front of your work and slip the stitch back to the left needle this wraps the second stitch turn your work and knit the number of stitches indicated note picking up and knitting the wraps in this pattern is optional 2 body work begins at neckline begin by preparing a second
